text: hey guys I'm Alex thanks for clicking
and welcome to this lesson on school
slang so in this lesson I'm going to
teach you five common slang expressions
or words that have to do with school and
since many of you are university
students high school students if you've
ever been a student this could be useful
to you especially if you end up going to
an english-speaking university okay so I
have five sentences and I have circled
five of the slang expressions for you so
the first one says our grammar teacher
gave us a pop quiz today
now the word pop when you think of pop
you think of right little explosions so
a pop quiz is something that you don't
expect so a pop quiz is basically a
surprise test right a test you did not
know was coming you did not expect so
this is a surprise test okay so if your
teacher ever gives you a pop quiz you
have to be it's almost impossible to be
prepared 100% but if you've been paying
attention and listening in class it
should be okay okay the second
expression is related to school here is
straight A's so if you look at the
context of this sentence I got straight
A's on my report card what do you think
it means well to understand straight A's
you have to know that in many
english-speaking countries Western
countries grades scoring marking is
based on an alphabetic system okay so an
a right is a very very good grade and an
F is a failure right F if you've watched
the Simpsons you know Bart Simpson gets
an F sometimes a lot of the time except
that episode where he got a C+ and he
was really happy so
straight A's all right straight A's on
my report card means I got perfect
grades okay
perfect scores perfect grades
okay the next sentence we have is I had
to cram for my biology exam this morning
now when you think the word cram think
of getting information and just pushing
it into your brain so you have let's say
three hours before your exam okay and
you didn't study yesterday and you
should have studied yesterday but now
you only have three hours you don't know
anything
you're worried so you have to get a lot
of information into your brain in a
short amount of time so this is cramming
okay so if you cram for an exam it means
that you are studying and trying to get
a lot of information memorize a lot of
information in a very short amount of
time okay I had to again memorize a lot
of information I'm just going to put
info in a short time okay the next
expression we have is killed or to kill
a test kill an exam so Joanna said she
killed her test now does that this mean
she got a knife or her pen and just
killed her test it's a piece of paper
it's not a living thing it's impossible
right if you kill a test it means that
you do very very well okay that you just
murdered it you killed it you had no
problems with it okay so if you kill a
test kill an exam you do extremely well
so Joanna said she killed her test she
did extremely well she did very well
right like maybe 95 percent or a hundred
percent she killed it this is the
opposite so I'm afraid I'm scared of
bombing my history exam now you think of
the word bomb okay this is this is not
similar to kill where you kill a test
this is like you explode because you did
so badly on the test so if I bombed the
test I did very very badly it's like I'm
dropping bombs on on my piece of paper
and nothing is making any sense okay I'm
afraid of bombing my history exam
bombing is failing or doing very badly
on or doing very badly on so if I say I
bombed my test I bombed my exam I failed
it I did very very badly on it okay guys
so just as a review a pop quiz is a
surprise test straight A's perfect
grades to cram for a test means to study
a lot of information in a short amount
of time to kill a test is to just kill
it and get perfect grades or very very
close to perfect on the test to do very
well on it and again the opposite is
that you can say a test killed me if the
test kills you that means that the test
was really difficult and you didn't do
very well and finally if you bomb a test
or an exam it means you fail or do
extremely poorly on it
okay guys to test your understanding of
these slang expressions check out the
quiz on n vidcom take care
you
